stories.title: Snapchat to dethrone TikTok to become fastest-growing social media platform in 2023 (2 minute read)
stories.tldr: Snapchat is expected to grow its user base by 13.4% in 2023, making it the fastest-growing social media platform. Its growth stems from younger generations, with almost 60% of all internet users aged 13 to 24 using the app daily.

stories.title: Bing Search Tests Explore Collections Overlay (1 minute read)
stories.tldr: Bing is testing a new feature to help users explore products in search. ‚ÄòExplore collections‚Äô opens a near-full page overlay where users can see a collection of similar items. Ads also appear within this overlay.

stories.title: Marketing to Gen Z: How to get it right (3 minute read)
stories.tldr: Data shows that 87% of Gen Z want multi-channel brand experiences - they have a newfound appreciation for in-person events and want experiential shopping experiences. They also value authenticity, playfulness, and fun. Brands are getting more creative in using digital out-of-home to build trust between brands and consumers.

stories.title: The August 18 Algo Update caused a massive drop in indented results (3 minute read)
stories.tldr: Over time, indented results have become less prevalent - but there was a marked decrease following Google‚Äôs latest core update.

stories.title: TikTok SEO: The Ultimate Guide to Boosting Your Profile Visibility (11 minute read)
stories.tldr: TikTok SEO involves optimizing your content so it‚Äôs more likely to show up on your audience‚Äôs For You Page and ranks higher in app search results. Best practices include using TikTok‚Äôs Keyword Insights tool to guide content creation, engaging with users when they comment, and collaborating with other TikTok accounts.

stories.title: Improve your messaging: focus on the use case, not the limitation (LinkedIn Post)
stories.tldr: Calling out a limitation of a solution is often not enough for someone to try something else. Instead, connect that limitation to the original use case. For example, a limitation of taking written notes in a meeting is that it‚Äôs slow, which means it‚Äôs less efficient but also helps memory recall. A problem with this method is notetakers could miss points in fast-paced discussions -  which is what a marketer with an alternative solution should focus on.

stories.title: How the YouTube Shorts Algorithm Works, According to YouTube (5 minute read)
stories.tldr: Content on Shorts is ranked based on user engagement through likes, comments, and shares, watch time, and responses from user surveys. The algorithm for Shorts prioritizes videos that keep viewers watching until the end and longer videos tend to perform better on the platform.

stories.title: 5 tools you need for link building (LinkedIn Post)
stories.tldr: Link building can be difficult and time-consuming. This post includes 5 valuable tools that can make your link building process more efficient: Linkly, Respona, Connectively (HARO), Prowly, and Semrush.

stories.title: 4 top affiliate search partners to consider: A breakdown (5 minute read)
stories.tldr: Affiliate search partners can help brands by driving traffic and revenue with low risk. This article covers 4 major affiliate marketing partners: PromoCodesForYou, Offers.com, Slickdeals, and CouponCause. It discusses their strengths and what they are best suited for.

stories.title: How to create a lead magnet your audience will love (9 minute read)
stories.tldr: A lead magnet represents an exchange of value. It can come in the form of free access to something like a template, resource, or service. This post shares how to create something unique that people cannot find elsewhere, write compelling CTAs, and let your customers be the centerpiece of your communication.

stories.title: Why Businesses Weren‚Äôt Ready to Transition from Universal Analytics to GA4 (3 minute read)
stories.tldr: As Google's Universal Analytics transitioned to GA4, SMBs are facing enormous challenges through the steep learning curve of the tool.
